    • Constructor Detail

      • Combiscope

        public Combiscope(int baudRate,
                  int bits,
                  int stopBits,
                  int parity)
        Instantiates a Combiscope object used for interfacing with a Phillips/Fluke Combiscope. This is done using the jSerialComm library.
        Parameters:
        baudRate - Serial baud rate (Often 9600)
        bits - serial bits (usually 8, sometimes 7)
        stopBits - serial stop bits (usually 1)
        parity - serial parity (usually 0)

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Uses the "ID" command to retrieve info about the oscilloscope.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string consisting of info about the oscilloscope.

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Tells if the serial port is open or not.
        Returns:
        True if the port is open, and false if it is not.

      • updateInfo

        Updates oscilloscope identification information.

        Arms the oscilloscope trigger.

      • defaultSetup

        public void defaultSetup()
        Returns the oscilloscope to the default setup.

      • resetInstrument

        public void resetInstrument()
        Resets all the software on the oscilloscope. Settings remain the same. The interface parameters aren't changed so the communication will stay alive. WARNING: I haven't tested this command. There is NO front panel equivalent for this command.

      • performSoftwareTrigger

        public void performSoftwareTrigger()
        Causes an acquisition or sweep to be started. If using single shot mode, use the armTrigger() method first.

      • setFrontPanelMode

        public void setFrontPanelMode(int mode)
        Changes the amount of control the user has at the front panel of the oscilloscope. Local mode allows full control of the scope from the front panel. Remote mode disables front panel control, but pressing STATUS/LOCAL will return the scope to local mode. Local Lockout disables STATUS/LOCAL, making it impossible to return the scope to local mode from the front panel besides powering off/on.
        Parameters:
        mode - 0 - Local, 1 - Remote, 2 - Local Lockout.

      • getWaveform

        public short[] getWaveform(int channel,
                           int memoryRegister)
        Returns an array of 16-bit signed integers representing a waveform. NOTE: Works on all acquisition lengths!
        Parameters:
        channel - Channel to read from.
        memoryRegister - Memory register to read from. 0 will read from the acquisition memory.
        Returns:
        An array of 16-bit integers representing the waveform.

      • getSetup

        public byte[] getSetup()
        Uses the QS command to retrieve the setup info of the oscilloscope. Note: User's manual states the purpose of the setup nodes: "Applications: The setup nodes for different timebase settings can be stored separately. They can be used afterwards as fixed ’templates’ to change only the oscilloscope timebase setup." Translation: "There's no way that we are going to write hundreds of pages on how to decode the setup info."
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the setup info.

      • programSetup

        public void programSetup(byte[] input)
        Saves a setup to the oscilloscope.
        Parameters:
        input - A byte array consisting of a setup. Get this array using the getSetup() method.
